Class OneTimePassword

java.lang.Object
database.model.BaseEntity
database.model.entities.OneTimePassword
public class OneTimePassword extends BaseEntity
Represents a one-time password (OTP) used for authentication or validation.

This class generates a random OTP, stores the creator and target IDs, and provides methods to check if the OTP has been used, as well as to retrieve the OTP value and its plain text form.

Author:
Dhruv

  • Constructor Details

    • OneTimePassword

      public OneTimePassword()
      Default constructor for OneTimePassword. Initializes a new OTP with the default values (not used) and a randomly generated OTP value.

    • OneTimePassword

      public OneTimePassword(int creatorId, int targetId)
      Convenience constructor for OneTimePassword with the specified creator and target IDs.
      Parameters:
      creatorId - The ID of the user who created the OTP.
      targetId - The ID of the user who is the target of the OTP.

  • Method Details

    • getCreatorId

      public int getCreatorId()
      Gets the ID of the creator of the OTP.
      Returns:
      The creator's ID.

    • setCreatorId

      public void setCreatorId(int creatorId)
      Sets the ID of the creator of the OTP.
      Parameters:
      creatorId - The new creator ID to be set.

    • getTargetId

      public int getTargetId()
      Gets the ID of the target user for whom the OTP is generated.
      Returns:
      The target user's ID.

    • setTargetId

      public void setTargetId(int targetId)
      Sets the ID of the target user for whom the OTP is generated.
      Parameters:
      targetId - The new target ID to be set.

    • isUsed

      public boolean isUsed()
      Gets whether the OTP has been used.
      Returns:
      true if the OTP has been used, false otherwise.

    • setUsed

      public void setUsed(boolean used)
      Sets the status of whether the OTP has been used.
      Parameters:
      used - The new status of the OTP's usage.

    • getOtpValue

      public String getOtpValue()
      Gets the OTP value, which is the hashed version of the OTP.
      Returns:
      The hashed OTP value.

    • setOtpValue

      public void setOtpValue(String otpValue)
      Sets the OTP value (hashed).
      Parameters:
      otpValue - The new OTP value to be set.

    • getPlainOtp

      public String getPlainOtp()
      Returns the plain OTP value (before it is hashed).

      This method is used to retrieve the OTP in its raw form before any hashing or encryption is applied.

      Returns:
      The plaintext OTP value.
